availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William K. Irwin (U.S. Army sergeant and lieutenant)

body.p: U.S. Army sergeant and lieutenant. Pennsylvania native. Ship carpenter in 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant and lieutenant from September 9, 1861, to August 15, 1864. Died in Nashville, Tennessee, of smallpox on August 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 0144, 0479.
